item.title: Marketplace Roundtable #12: Keeping An Open Mind In Tech With Joe Albano
item.description: Tech is always in the news, and it's started 2019 as a renewed market leader. But between trade talks, the ups and downs for Apple, and periodic calls for regulation, it's unclear where the sector will go from here. Joe Albano, author of Tech Cache, shares some of his long ideas and how he maintains flexibility while trusting in his intuition at the same time.
item.itunes:title: Keeping An Open Mind In Tech With Joe Albano
item.itunes:author: Seeking Alpha
item.itunes:subtitle: FAANG's big sell-off has created opportunities, but what does that mean for tech at large?

item.title: Marketplace Roundtable #10: The Industrial Metal Opportunity With Joshua Hall
item.description: Miners can be their own animal in the market, with different production and earnings cycles than many other stocks. Joshua Hall of Industrial Minefinder discusses his unique view on the market, what he sees as misconceptions in the junior miner space, the difference between major miners and other businesses, how to deal with country risk, and a favorite idea.
item.itunes:title: The Industrial Metal Opportunity With Joshua Hall
item.itunes:author: Seeking Alpha
item.itunes:subtitle: Miners require investors to do their own work - where can they focus?

item.description: Biotech specialist Jerome Verony of Second-Level Investing sits down with Seeking Alpha's Jonathan Liss for a wide-ranging conversation on investing in the sector and all that requires. In the second half of the show, Jerome shares his current top biotech investing ideas.

item.title: Marketplace Roundtable #8: REITs Offering Value, with Brad Thomas
item.description: Real estate is a long-lived asset, but REITs seem to trade on short-term sentiment time and again. That opens up opportunities, according to Brad Thomas of Rhino Real Estate Advisors. He joins the Marketplace Roundtable to talk about the opportunities he sees in communications REITs, industrial REITs, and other corners of the growing real estate market.
item.itunes:title: REITs Offering Value, with Brad Thomas
item.itunes:author: Seeking Alpha
item.itunes:subtitle: 2018 was rough for the real estate sector, but that means the long-lived assets offer value, according to Brad Thomas.

item.title: Marketplace Roundtable #7: Value Investing For The 21st Century With Chris DeMuth Jr.
item.description: Value investing, like any investing style, can get dogmatic. Chris DeMuth Jr., the host of Sifting the World and founder of Rangeley Capital, shares his approach for value investing in the current market and how to find ideas where others aren't looking.
item.itunes:title: Value Investing For The 21st Century With Chris DeMuth Jr.

item.title: Marketplace Roundtable #6: The Power Of Cash Flow With Darren McCammon
item.description: Investing is simple, but not easy. Darren McCammon, the author of Cash Flow Kingdom, discusses the hard work that goes into his investments, but also the way well-covered dividends help him sleep well at night when the market is selling off. He also shares a few long-term theses, including the marijuana sector and the natural gas/LNG trade play.
item.itunes:title: The Power Of Cash Flow With Darren McCammon
item.itunes:author: Seeking Alpha
item.itunes:subtitle: How a steady yield can help your work through a market downturn

item.title: Marketplace Roundtable #5: The Gospel Of Elliott Wave With Avi Gilburt
item.description: Technical analysis has its skeptics, but Avi Gilburt explains his approach to Elliott Wave investing and why he believes it works. Essentially, it's just a way to read into the broader psychology of the markets. On this week's podcast, he discusses how he came to Elliott Wave and why it's as relevant as ever in today's markets. Topics covered: 2:00 - How the discovery of Elliott Wave transformed Avi's approach to investing and how he started giving other investors investing advice 5:40 - A brief ov

item.title: Marketplace Roundtable #4: Exploiting Microcap Inefficiencies With Safety in Value
item.description: In the midst of of whiplash-inducing sell-off and bounce-back rallies in all the major equity indexes, including the microcap benchmark Russell 2000, what's the case for microcap investing? We speak with Safety In Value, who admits there is a lot of garbage out there in the space, but argues that there is still attractive potential as long as investors remember to protect their downside. item.description: With rising interest rates and a volatile market, the game plan of chasing yields in recent years may no longer apply. item.title: Marketplace Roundtable #2: Bracing For The Fed And The Trade War With Kirk Spano
item.description: The themes of passive/algorithmic investing taking over the market long term, and the trade war and Federal Reserve in the near term loom large over our second Marketplace Roundtable podcast. Margin of Safety Investing author Kirk Spano discusses his investing approach and the importance of quantitative and macro analysis, the macro risks in the market today, whether he's in a defensive or offensive position, and the sector that most interests him Topics covered: 1:15 minute mark - The core 4 approach Kirk

item.title: Marketplace Roundtable #1: Michael Wiggins de Oliveira on Deep Value and Big Tech
item.description: Deep Value and Tech don't naturally go together. But Michael Wiggins de Oliveira explains how he follows both, and how his work on tech stocks informs his deep value investing. He shares a few investment ideas as well as his views on where AMD, Amazon, and Netflix may be heading (hint: not higher). Topics covered: 1:15 minute mark - Investing approach - the focus on free cash flow 5:00 - Lessons learned - the power of not knowing 7:30 - 2018 lessons - things take longer to play out than expecte
